definition: lit. to burn zithers and cook cranes/fig. to waste valuable resources/to destroy wantonly beautiful things
to burn
guqin 古琴[gu3 qin2] (a type of zither)/musical instrument in general
variant of 琴[qin2], guqin or zither
to cook/to boil
variant of 煮[zhu3]
crane
see 大殺風景|大杀风景[da4 sha1 feng1 jing3]
to waste natural resources recklessly/not to know how to use things sparingly
to be a blot on the landscape/to dampen spirits/to spoil the fun/to be a wet blanket
refined activities of the intellectuals (regarding literature, paintings etc)
to cast pearls before swine (idiom)/not to get proper recognition for one's talents
to buy a wooden box and return the pearls inside/to show poor judgment (idiom)
disappointed
(of an uneducated person) to mingle with the cognoscenti/to pose as a culture lover/to be a culture snob/having pretensions to culture
lit. to play the lute to a cow (idiom)/fig. offering a treat to an unappreciative audience/to cast pearls before swine/caviar to the general/to preach to deaf ears/to talk over sb's head
cultured/sophisticated
not according with decorum (idiom); scandalous/bad form/unacceptable behavior
variant of 煞風景|煞风景[sha1 feng1 jing3]
to dig one's own grave
to make a fool of oneself/to make oneself a laughing stock
lit. singing of the wind and the moon; fig. vacuous and sentimental (of poetry or art)
intolerably vulgar
